title: How well does an OS X virtualised guest work under a FreeBSD host? - Quora

response.answer_text: My response here doesn’t really qualify as an “answer” but, since it seems that many of the responses are missing the point of the question, I thought I would provide a link to some work that has been shared, and that actually proves that this can be done, despite what some of the respondents have said. kholia/OSX-KVM I’ve not yet tried this (and won’t be trying it on a Mac-mini). The example is specific to running the VM on a Linux host using QEMU. I suspect that the only real possible issue might be graphic support in QEMU running on FreeBSD. Note that this has nothing to do with Hackintosh or underlying hardware. Credit goes to Dhiru Kholia who may be able to provide a more educated opinion. EDIT: As I dig into this more, other contributors to this effort include Evgeny Grin and others as mentioned on the github page.

Running OS X or MacOS on non-Apple hardware (including virtualized hardware) is not supported by Apple at all. Which is not to say you can't make it work. Google “Hackintosh” to go down the rabbit hole.
